hypothesis_content.title: Large Options Expiry Gamma Squeeze Amplification
hypothesis_content.statement: During NEUTRAL regimes, when BTC faces a large (>$20B) monthly options expiry within 3 days, a price move beyond the max pain point by >2% triggers amplified directional momentum as dealers hedge gamma exposure, creating a 1.5-2x volatility expansion relative to normal conditions.
hypothesis_content.rationale: Large options expiries create concentrated gamma exposure. When price moves beyond key dealer hedging zones (max pain), dealers are forced to dynamically hedge by buying/selling spot, amplifying the initial move. Current $28B Boxing Day expiry represents significant gamma wall.
entry_conditions: BTC within 3 days of monthly options expiry with notional >$20B
BTC price breaks through max pain point by >2% (current max pain: ~$86,500)
1-hour RSI crosses 70 (bullish) or 30 (bearish) in direction of break

exit_conditions.take_profit: 8% move from entry OR volatility returns to 30-day average
exit_conditions.stop_loss: Reversal back through max pain point
exit_conditions.time_exit: 24 hours post-entry OR options expiry completion

hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: Price breaks max pain but fails to sustain momentum (reverses within 2 hours) OR volatility remains within normal bands despite the break.
